Transcription for 18941

The traffic lights at the junction of Landmase Road and Clampton Major Bypass stand on the
spot where the gallows are said to have stood many, many moons ago. As Landmase Road was
always known as Gallows Way, the town hall was said to have been the courthouse, and
many miscreants were then sent to the gallows up the road. There is a certain amount of
difficulty with this story, as the manor courts that were held in the town hall never had
that responsibility of putting people to death. But it is a nice story.
